metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3194 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
crypto/rsa/rsa_ameth.c in OpenSSL 1.0.1 before 1.0.1q and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2e allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) via an RSA PSS ASN.1 signature that lacks a mask generation function parameter.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3194` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.16
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.16').
